posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
A somewhat different build request... OK, so on my PW of choice, Blackstone Keep, I am going to set up two characters that can make potions, wands and scrolls of every kind. According to rumour, you can make almost anything with only two toons if you set them up right. Here's all the info I've managed to get about the "supplier twins".

"You need one 12bard/9wiz/21cleric (15 INT, 14 CHA, 20 WIS) and one paladin16/druid24 (full wis)".

That's not sufficient information for me. I can't make two builds that are at least semi-playable and can make all scrolls/potions/wands out of that meagre recipe. Can anyone help?
Note that if I can start both of them up this week, they don't actually need to be very playable, since I have 1.6 million XP in the XP-bank (outgoing feature, will be gone soon) and can more or less set these up right at lvl 36 or so.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I would make three of them, and they would all be playable/sufficiently optimized for forty-level play as well.

One prime-Paladin, one prime-Bard and one order of Jormungandr (Druid 18/ Cleric 20/ Monk 2).

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I think Val's idea is good.  Some solid playable classes with crafting skills

Confused a little though. I think you are missing higher level Wizard scrolls. You know the Time Stop / IGMS etc combo... (Wizard players know this better than me)

Maybe a Paladin 16/Wizard 24 might allow access to Paladin + Wizard scrolls + other Epic spells like EMA and Epic Warding
Is Bard a good crafting class on BK? I thought their spellbook was limited to what you choose when you level up but maybe there is some uber spell to craft I'm not aware of?
Also can u do Paladin / Druid on BK? normally requires alignment change

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
Orion2019 wrote: I think Val's idea is good.  Some solid playable classes with crafting skills

Confused a little though. I think you are missing higher level Wizard scrolls. You know the Time Stop / IGMS etc combo... (Wizard players know this better than me)

Maybe a Paladin 16/Wizard 24 might allow access to Paladin + Wizard scrolls + other Epic spells like EMA and Epic Warding
Is Bard a good crafting class on BK? I thought their spellbook was limited to what you choose when you level up but maybe there is some uber spell to craft I'm not aware of?
Also can u do Paladin / Druid on BK? normally requires alignment change
Already have a full Wizard. That's why I was going for two toons. Too many toons makes the player confused.
You can make alignment changes. It costs you a bunch of xp if I remember correctly. Also, as long as you don't mix order/chaos, you can mix most stuff. You can't make bard/barbarian for instance.
https://blackstonekeep.com/viewtopic.php?f=1&t=226

Already have a paladin and a bard at lvl 40, don't want to do it over again. Looking for shortcut now while the XP bank is still open.

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content:
OK, after scouring the lvl 40 forums, I kinda landed in this:

Paladin supplier:
Still no finished idea, but 20/20 split and all the scribe scroll/create wand/mix potion feats should be straightforward. Or, I can use this:
dragon-lance-divine-dragon-pal29-rdd10- ... 94236.html
I kinda like this because it's the highest level of paladin level used in any build (unless I missed a few) with 29 levels of paladin. Also, I liked the name....

Bard supplier:
funeral-march-bard-26-blackguard-4-pale ... 15385.html
Is this useable, it's one of the oldest builds here!?!?

Druid supplier:
Druid18/Cleric20/Monk2, the updated Jormungandr, so far non-existant. If I knew anything about shifters/druids, maybe I should try my hand at it....

As for Cleric supplier, I have a cleric that I might be able to re-vamp and add a feat for scrolls.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I don't pretend to expertise in any of these, but certainly others in Tyr Templar's series of dragon builds are very good, so I'd have no qualms in recommending it. Equally, one does not question a Kail Pendragon build (it's the law), assuming it's at least v1.69 compliant, which Funeral March certainly appears to be.

As to Jormungandr...any volunteers? [Why is everyone sitting on their hands?] Maybe Valerfor, as he brought it up in the first place?

Cheers

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote: As to Jormungandr...any volunteers? [Why is everyone sitting on their hands?] Maybe Valerfor, as he brought it up in the first place?
Alright dammit, I'll take care of it.

But if we are going to do that, then better we do it right & produce something better than the original even if it's for 0.001 %, so I'll put it on the "unfinished" section & once I finish the first draft, I want you all, to pass it throught the microscope.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Thou art a fine fellow! I for one look forward to the results of your travails.

EDIT: And anyway, it feels great to turn the tables here - he-he!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: Alright dammit, I'll take care of it.

But if we are going to do that, then better we do it right & produce something better than the original even if it's for 0.001 %, so I'll put it on the "unfinished" section & once I finish the first draft, I want you all, to pass it throught the microscope.
I think an updated version made by the ECB is going to be amazing. I'll start the ball rolling with a few suggestions which I'm cool with people critiquing / praising. Assuming a change to Druid 18/Cleric 22/Monk 2 and comparing it to the original,

- dump str to 8 and increase cons to 14 for more HP and a higher fortitude save in Cleric/Druid form. Str is going to be capped with Divine Power anyway once it is obtained. I find Str 8 is quite playable as a Druid and Thax's also commented on that previously.
- monk at 7 for discipline/tumble dump, and playability over a longer period of the game as a shapeshifted druid/monk, (this is probably the biggest quality of life change) and keep monk at 39 for further skill dumps to nearly max out discipline and get tumble 40
- keep Kail's target for DS at 33
- OoJ is going to have close to two full spell books with druid and cleric spells so keeping penetration feats sounds great
-  spell focus / gsf / esf school with a sky high wisdom stat (buffed with Owl's Insight for +9 and Owl's Wisdom for 1d4+1) is tempting but I think Kail may not have included them for a reason. 
- craft magic feats with lvl 9 cleric/druid spells are tempting, but I would say they are situational depending on the shopkeeper access players have. 
- RE cleric domains - trickery domain I like. I think strength domain would be good for more casts of divine power. I can understand why Kail took Travel for access to the haste spell however. Would be tempting to take Brew Potion with Travel/Trickery domain for large numbers of potions of speed and invisibility whilst in dragon form.
- zen archery could still be good combined with Divine Power and Favor for a bit more versatility
- I wonder if Expertise and Armor Skin are necessary, as the Dragon's AC is going to be sky high anyway, and the enemy will probably need to roll a 1 just to hit you regardless

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I am very close to finish the first draft of the build, it seems Orion took the initiative & gave some good suggestions about the build and...it was exactly what I was doing, heh.

a) I'm still not sure about the penetration feats but having some of it is better than nothing, so I will let them stand for now. 

b) Expertise is mainly there in order to help the first levels but if we get rid of it & change two Gr. Wisdom feats we can possibly have ESF: (Pick your favorite) Conjuration OR Evocation.

c) Armour Skin is out anyway, because it was delivered from the epic bonus feat from Cleric (23).

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Well that's all well and good Orion, but seriously, let's get Valerfor doing some work here - stop helping - he doesn't volunteer often these days!

Oh bloody hell, ninja'd by the man himself. Still, I'll let it stand

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
That's really quick Valerfor and Stag! Glad my thoughts were somewhat aligned with your own, perhaps I'm learning something :)

mmmm RE evocation vs conjuration... not sure. my experience is superbiased towards druid and cleric is the higher caster level. 

Anyway am super excited by the build you are writing Valerfor, look forward to it, I'm sure its gonna be great. Once its reviewed and gets play tested its going to be amazing.


Edit: I forgot about the 20% multiclass penalty and -1AB if you take Monk at 7... I think I understand why Kail did that now...

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: I did that at 13th-level right after you get the greater animal shapes. I think the tremendous help it provides along the journey warrants the small sacrifice in experience points.
